intro: Lightfootia fruticosa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm. The plant features dense, velvety foliage and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, blue, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Lightfootia fruticosa is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
